articles.headline: State Accuses Intel in an Antitrust Suit
articles.snippet: New York’s attorney general charged the company with abusing its dominant position in the chip market.
articles.abstract: New York’s attorney general charged the company with abusing its dominant position in the chip market.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2005, Michael S. Dell’s namesake company was getting pounded. His competitors were selling personal computers and servers built on cheap, popular and powerful chips from Advanced Micro Devices, while Mr. Dell had stuck loyally with slower chips from Intel.

articles.headline: Party’s Over: A New Tone for Chrysler
articles.snippet: Chrysler had $5.7 billion in cash on hand at the end of September, up from the $4 billion it had in June after emerging from bankruptcy, its chief executive said.
articles.abstract: Chrysler had $5.7 billion in cash on hand at the end of September, up from the $4 billion it had in June after emerging from bankruptcy, its chief executive said.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUBURN HILLS, Mich.  The old Chrysler was famous for its aggressive marketing and auto-show stunts, like running a cattle drive down the streets of Detroit to publicize a new pickup.
articles.byline: By Bill Vlasic and Nick Bunkley

articles.headline: J.P. Morgan Settles Alabama Bribery Case
articles.snippet: J.P. Morgan Securities will forfeit fees on derivative contracts it sold to Jefferson County, Ala., to settle charges that it bribed officials to win business.
articles.abstract: J.P. Morgan Securities will forfeit fees on derivative contracts it sold to Jefferson County, Ala., to settle charges that it bribed officials to win business.
articles.lead_paragraph: J. P. Morgan Securities will forfeit hundreds of millions of dollars in fees on derivatives contracts that it sold an Alabama county, under a settlement announced Wednesday that could offer hope to other governments staggering under similar deals.

articles.headline: Fed Sees No Need to Raise Interest Rates Soon
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve signaled that it wasn’t close to raising interest rates, saying the economy was still weak.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve signaled that it wasn’t close to raising interest rates, saying the economy was still weak.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve signaled on Wednesday it was not close to raising interest rates, saying that the economy remained weak even though the recession appeared to be over.

articles.headline: A Place to Put Your Apps
articles.snippet: Motorola offers the Droid, a mobile device that defies categories. It’s not exactly a smartphone, not exactly an iPhone. It’s...
articles.abstract: Motorola offers the Droid, a mobile device that defies categories. It’s not exactly a smartphone, not exactly an iPhone. It’s...
articles.lead_paragraph: Last week, I reviewed not one, but three new phones. You’d think that would be enough for a while, but fall is peak season for new mobile devices, and another major release — Motorola’s Droid — is upon us this week.

articles.headline: After Mickey’s Makeover, Less Mr. Nice Guy
articles.snippet: For years, the Disney character was squeaky clean. His makeover will start with the release of a video game in which he can be cantankerous and cunning.
articles.abstract: For years, the Disney character was squeaky clean. His makeover will start with the release of a video game in which he can be cantankerous and cunning.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  For decades, the Walt Disney Company has largely kept Mickey Mouse frozen under glass, fearful that even the tiniest tinkering might tarnish the brand and upend his $5 billion or so in annual merchandise sales. One false move and Disney could have New Coke on its hands.

articles.headline: Costs Surge for Medical Devices, but Benefits Are Opaque
articles.snippet: Medical devices may seem an inviting target to better control Medicare spending, but plans for a health care overhaul do not address the quality or the cost of the products.
articles.abstract: Medical devices may seem an inviting target to better control Medicare spending, but plans for a health care overhaul do not address the quality or the cost of the products.
articles.lead_paragraph: When makers of heart defibrillators wanted Medicare to vastly expand the types of patients eligible to receive the devices, which can cost upward of $25,000, agency officials were skeptical. It was not clear how many of those patients would actually need a defibrillator, a device that can deliver a life-saving shock to restore a faltering heart to normal rhythm.

articles.headline: Energized G.O.P. Looks to Avoid Party Feud
articles.snippet: Republican leaders began maneuvering to avoid a prolonged battle with conservative activists.
articles.abstract: Republican leaders began maneuvering to avoid a prolonged battle with conservative activists.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Republicans emerged from Tuesday’s elections energized by victories in Virginia and New Jersey, but their leaders immediately began maneuvering to avoid a prolonged battle with conservative activists over what the party stands for and how to regain power.
